ai-ja474:1.1_0: “Seeing the fruit of my mango tree,
ai-ja474:2.1_0: “I’m not shared with the snare of death;
ai-ja474:2.2_0: and I’m not a moment of the mind.
ai-ja474:4.1_0: I used to live with your heart
ai-ja474:4.2_0: with fruits of life as a brahmin,
ai-ja474:4.3_0: don’t tremble or get hold of the mind;
ai-ja474:5.4_0: Debt, he’d come to the goal.
ai-ja474:6.4_0: I’ve given up birth and death.”
ai-ja474:7.4_0: for he is hard to endure.
ai-ja474:8.4_0: and it was no supreme person.
ai-ja474:9.3_0: When you’ve gained the highest state,
ai-ja474:10.3_0: They stepped on the dark or bright,
ai-ja474:10.4_0: blind to a blind man holding his light;
ai-ja474:10.5_0: That’s how you hold on to me,
ai-ja474:10.6_0: they’ve given up again and again.
ai-ja474:11.1_0: I used to live on Dhamma
ai-ja474:11.2_0: with the taste of the Dhamma.
ai-ja474:11.4_0: and steady in principle, they wouldn’t steam.
ai-ja474:13.4_0: Where can I prevail over the mind?”
